p: To elucidate the molecular mechanisms underlying the excessive accumulation of hyaluronan in serum of dengue-infected individuals, we investigated the effects of recombinant viral NS1 protein; the preparation contained monomeric and oligomeric forms as revealed by immunoblotting (Fig. S2 a). Using fluorescein diacetate / propidium iodide assay, we verified that treatment of dermal fibroblasts and endothelial cells with up to 9 μg NS1/ml did not affect the viability of cells (Fig. S2 b and d). NS1 treatment of dermal fibroblasts potently stimulated the expression of HAS1, HAS2 and HAS3 ( Fig. 2 a). Noteworthy, the basal HAS2 transcript levels in fibroblast cultures was 100-fold higher than HAS1 and HAS3 transcripts, and it was further 3-fold increased at 6 h after NS1 treatment (Fig. S2 c). NS1 did not affect the amount of HYAL1 and HYAL2 transcripts, but significantly increased the high basal CD44 mRNA level in dermal fibroblasts ( Fig. 2 a).
